intro: Tragacantha gebleri, commonly known as the Gebleri tragacanth, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant produces a distinctive resinous substance, which is harvested for its medicinal and industrial uses. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties. Tragacantha gebleri thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
